noun.description: An outline, especially one representing or bounding the shape or form of something.
examples: she traced the contours of his face with her finger

verb.description: Mold into a specific shape, especially one designed to fit into something else.
examples: the compartment has been contoured with smooth rounded corners

verb.description: Mark (a map or diagram) with contour lines.
examples: a variety of different data sources have been compiled to contour the maps

verb.description: (of a road or railroad) follow the outline of (a topographical feature), especially along a contour line.

origin: Mid 17th century: from French, from Italian contorno, from contornare draw in outline, from con- together + tornare to turn.
